sentences.english: A man, like a sword, rusts in idleness.
sentences.chinese: 刀不用會生鏽，人閒着會怠惰。

sentences.english: Burnout is an obstacle like any other.
Sometimes burnout can be an illusion.
sentences.chinese: 有時候，怠惰可能是一個幻覺。

sentences.english: It’s hard to spot burnout from the inside.
sentences.chinese: 要認識到自己陷入了怠惰狀態，這很難。

sentences.english: But even when we do that out of indolence and sloth.
sentences.chinese: 但是，即使我們出於怠惰，懶散這樣做了。

sentences.english: But it seems more like laziness and bad planning.
sentences.chinese: 然在吾觀之，此更似怠惰和昏招下的敗筆。

sentences.english: But thellonking is far different from laziness.
sentences.chinese: 沒有最佳謎底但念考有很大區別怠惰。

sentences.english: Q. You work with someone you think is lazy and resent him for it.
sentences.chinese: 你和一個你覺得很怠惰的人共事，很氣他這個樣子。

sentences.english: These small lapses took place against the  background of a much bigger lapse.
sentences.chinese: 這些小失誤發生的背景，是一種嚴重得多的怠惰。

sentences.english: When we get comfortable with a certain way of life we get lazy.
sentences.chinese: 當我們過慣了舒服的生活後，我們就會變得怠惰。

sentences.english: Such sloppiness, usually from haste or laziness, is noticeable.
sentences.chinese: 因爲趕時間或怠惰造成的草率馬虎是很明顯的。

sentences.english: These small lapses took place against the background of a much bigger lapse.
sentences.chinese: 這些小失誤發生的背景，是一種嚴重得多的怠惰。

sentences.english: The speaker lashed at the government for its inaction.
sentences.chinese: 發言人抨擊政府的怠惰。

definition: satisfied just to get through (idiom); to muddle through/without high ambitions, but getting by
not paying attention to anything (idiom); to idle time away
to become demoralized/to lose one's sense of purpose
to spend the whole day eating (i.e. not doing any work)
to take things as they are (idiom)/to leave a situation as it is/to be happy with the status quo
to love ease and comfort and hate work (idiom)
